abstract: Informal talks between Afghan government and Taliban produce several non-binding agreements that may be seen as progress in peace process; government concedes that country's constitution could be changed and that Taliban should open political office in Doha, Qatar; Taliban commits to education for women and girls and indicates that it may be willing to start negotiations before all foreign military personnel are withdrawn.
lead_paragraph: While not binding, agreements on matters such as the Constitution and the presence of foreign troops raised hopes about the long deadlocked process.

headline.main: Some Progress Is Reported in Informal Afghan-Taliban Talks
headline.print_headline: Some Progress Is Reported in Informal Afghan-Taliban Talks

snippet: While not binding, agreements on matters such as the Constitution and the presence of foreign troops raised hopes about the long deadlocked process.
